intro: Erigeron burejensis, commonly known as the Burej Mountain fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Erigeron burejensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
